revised_title: Active Very Low Frequency Experiments on the Magnetosphere from Siple Station, Antarctica
tldr: This article discusses active very low frequency (VLF) experiments conducted on the magnetosphere from Siple Station, Antarctica. VLF waves interact with charged particles in the magnetosphere, providing valuable information on the distribution and movement of magnetospheric plasma. These experiments help in understanding wave growth, wave-wave interactions, and wave-induced precipitation, which can affect the ionosphere and contribute to the International Magnetospheric Survey (IMS) and related space experiments.
